DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplant Relapse Risk Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Classification to signify the likelihood of recurrence of malignancy following hematopoietic cell transplantation, based on one or more of the following parameters: marrow morphology, flow cytometry, cytogenetic studies, including fluorescence in situ hybridization, electrophoresis, immunofixation assays, and polymerase chain reaction-based assays for disease  markers, or imaging results.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of malignancy following hematopoietic cell transplantation, based on one or more of the following parameters: marrow morphology, flow cytometry, cytogenetic studies, including fluorescence in situ hybridization, electrophoresis, immunofixation assays, and polymerase chain reaction-based assays for disease  markers, or imaging results._Risk is the potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable. (from WIkipedia)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of malignancy following hematopoietic cell transplantation, based on one or more of the following parameters: marrow morphology, flow cytometry, cytogenetic studies, including fluorescence in situ hybridization, electrophoresis, immunofixation assays, and polymerase chain reaction-based assays for disease  markers, or imaging results.

Concepts.definition: Recurrence of malignancy following hematopoietic cell transplantation, based on one or more of the following parameters: marrow morphology, flow cytometry, cytogenetic studies, including fluorescence in situ hybridization, electrophoresis, immunofixation assays, and polymerase chain reaction-based assays for disease markers, or imaging results.

Property.preferredDefinition: Risk is the potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable. (from WIkipedia)

Concepts.definition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplant Relapse Risk Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of malignancy following hematopoietic cell transplantation, based on one or more of the following parameters: marrow morphology, flow cytometry, cytogenetic studies, including fluorescence in situ hybridization, electrophoresis, immunofixation assays, and polymerase chain reaction-based assays for disease  markers, or imaging results._Risk is the potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable. (from WIkipedia)_Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hematopoietic Cell Transplant Relapse Standard Risk Rate

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplant Relapse Standard Risk Rate
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Risk of hematopoietic cell transplant relapse rates per patient year with p value between 0.26 and 0.37.

Concepts.longName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplant Relapse Standard Risk Rate
Concepts.definition: Risk of hematopoietic cell transplant relapse rates per patient year with p value between 0.26 and 0.37.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hematopoietic Cell Transplant Relapse Low Risk Rate

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplant Relapse Low Risk Rate
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Risk of hematopoietic cell transplant relapse rates per patient year with p value between 0.00 and 0.24.

Concepts.longName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplant Relapse Low Risk Rate
Concepts.definition: Risk of hematopoietic cell transplant relapse rates per patient year with p value between 0.00 and 0.24.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hematopoietic Cell Transplant Relapse High Risk Rate

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplant Relapse High Risk Rate
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Risk of hematopoietic cell transplant relapse rates per patient year with p value higher than 0.52.

Concepts.longName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplant Relapse High Risk Rate
Concepts.definition: Risk of hematopoietic cell transplant relapse rates per patient year with p value higher than 0.52.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.
